subtitle: Goat's cheese blends well with fruit. Do eat these cushions as soon as they are cooked.

method.text: Mix softened goat's cheese with garlic, basil, pine kernels and seasoning to taste.
Roll out puff pastry fairly thinly. Using a heart-shaped cutter, approx. 7 <sup>1</sup>/<sub>2</sub> cm, cut out 12 heart shapes of pastry.
Line 6 heart-shaped patty tins with half the pastry shapes. Press up the edges well. Brush the pastry rim with beaten egg.

Divide the goat's cheese mixture amongst the pastry lined cases. Top with the remaining pastry shapes and pinch the edges together to seal. Glaze with beaten egg. (Sprinkle with a few extra chopped pine kernals, if liked.)
Bake at 200°C for 15-20 min or until puffed and golden.

Meanwhile, make the sauce. Blend the halved plums, redcurrant jelly and brandy until smooth. As soon as the 'feuilletes' come out of the oven, make a small hole in the top crust of each on and pour in a spoonful of cream.
Serve immediately on small plates with a spoonful of the plum sauce garnished with basil.

title: Cheese cushions
